Name: takemura / takemura13
Title: The right part of the brain of a wild-type Oregon R female fly was serially sectioned into 40-nm slices.
ShortTitle: Wild-type Oregon R female fly was serially sectioned
Description: A semi-automated pipeline using electron microscopy to reconstruct a connectome, containing 379 neurons and 8,637 chemical synaptic contacts, within the Drosophila optic medulla

Name: helmstaedter13 / mouse_reti
Title: Mouse inner plexiform layer—the main computational neuropil region in the mammalian retina—the dense reconstruction of 950 neurons and their mutual contacts.
ShortTitle: Computatiol neuropil region in the mammalian reti
Description: Applying a combination of crowd-sourced manual annotation and machine-learning-based volume segmentation to serial block-face electron microscopy data to characterize a new type of retinal bipolar interneuron
Contributor: Moritz Helmstaedter|Kevin L. Briggman|Srinivas C. Turaga|Viren Jain|H. Sebastian Seung|Winfried Denk

Name: bumbarger / bumbarger13
Title: Electron microscopy of serial section through the anterior region of P. pacificus, of more than 3,000 sections and containing the entire pharynx
ShortTitle: Anterior region of P. pacificus pharnyx
Description: Serial thin section data were generated to compare the pharyngeal connectomes of the pharyngeal nervous system between Caenorhabditis elegans and Pristionchus pacificus.
Grant Name: No grant, funded by Max-Planck Society
Contributor: Daniel J.Bumbarger|Metta Riebesell|Christian Rödelsperger|Ralf J. Sommer

Name: bock / bock11
Title: Volume of mouse primary visual cortical data
ShortTitle: Mouse cortical data
Description:
Images were collected at approximately 4x4x45 cubic nanometers with a total volume of approximately 450x350x50 cubic microns.

This dataset has a Z offset of 2917. Data exists betwen z slices 2917 through 4155.
Contributor: Davi D. Bock|Wei-Chung Allen Lee|Aaron M. Kerlin|Mark L. Andermann|Greg Hood|Arthur W. Wetzel|Sergey Yurgenson|Edward R. Soucy|Hyon Suk Kim|R. Clay Reid
